sentences.sContent: India tolerated dissent, but it also tolerated inefficiency, disease and illiteracy.
sentences.sContent_eng: India tolerated dissent, but it also tolerated inefficiency, disease and illiteracy.
sentences.sCn: 印度容许异议，但同时它也容忍了无能、疾病与文盲。

sentences.sContent: Tackling corruption would be the fastest way to address problems like poverty, disease, and illiteracy, he contended.
sentences.sContent_eng: Tackling corruption would be the fastest way to address problems like poverty, disease, and illiteracy, he contended.
sentences.sCn: 他认为，反腐败可能是解决诸如贫困、疾病和文盲等问题的最快途径。

sentences.sContent: This great institution must work for great purposes -- to free people from tyranny and violence, hunger and disease, illiteracy and ignorance, and poverty and despair.
sentences.sContent_eng: This great institution must work for great purposes -- to free people from tyranny and violence, hunger and disease, illiteracy and ignorance, and poverty and despair.
sentences.sCn: 这个伟大的机构必须努力达到伟大的目的──使人们摆脱暴政与暴力、饥饿与疾病、文盲与愚昧、贫困与绝望。

words.tran: 文盲的；不识字的；没受教育的

trans.tranOther: Illiteracy is the state of not knowing how to read or write
